title: Adding Hyphenation dictionaries in Ind
content:
Is it possible to add more hyphenation dictionaries to InD? I like to test type in foreign languages but Adobe does not supply all of the. They have Library files such as “rus.hyp” which I assume do the trick. Are there others available and if so where? Is it possible to just drop a new “.hyp” file in the library and have that language supported and show up in the InD “Language” pop-up?

ChrisL

 [‹ TransType Pro Bug?](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806231117/http:/typophile.com/node/9796 "Go to previous forum topic") [Fontlab 5, multiple family styles Open Type or Type 1 ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806231117/http:/typophile.com/node/20460 "Go to next forum topic")
author: dezcom

comments.content:
“InDesign comes with 28 Proximity dictionaries for the following languages: Catalan, Czech\*, Danish,  
Dutch, English (Canadian\*, UK, USA, USA Legal, and USA Medical), Finnish, French, French Canadian,  
German (Reformed, Swiss, and Traditional), Greek\*, Hungarian\*, Italian, Norwegian (Bokmal and  
Nynorsk), Polish\*, Portuguese, Brazilian Portuguese, Russian\*, Slovak\*, Spanish: Castilian, Swedish, and  
Turkish\*. (Languages marked with an asterisk have been newly added to InDesign CS2.)”  
 [http://www.adobe.com/aboutadobe/pressroom/pressmaterials/creativesuite/p...](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806231117/http:/www.adobe.com/aboutadobe/pressroom/pressmaterials/creativesuite/pdfs/id/id_faq.pdf "http://www.adobe.com/aboutadobe/pressroom/pressmaterials/creativesuite/pdfs/id/id\_faq.pdf")

4.0.2 update adds support for seven Central European languages.  
 [http://www.adobe.com/support/downloads/detail.jsp?ftpID=3168](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806231117/http:/www.adobe.com/support/downloads/detail.jsp?ftpID=3168 "http://www.adobe.com/support/downloads/detail.jsp?ftpID=3168")

It is possible to use older Proximity dictionaries with InDesign CS by placing them from “Adobe\Linguistics\Providers\Proximity" to “Indesign CS\Plug-Ins\Dictionaries\Proximity" directory as Paul described here:  
 [http://www.typophile.com/node/17681](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806231117/http:/www.typophile.com/node/17681 "http://www.typophile.com/node/17681")

Thanks Alexy! That is twice you have helped me today!

ChrisL
